answers.q: how to connect wifi in lg e400
answers.a: This question is about an LG phone; E400 here refers to alginic acid, a seaweed-derived food thickener and stabilizer.

answers.q: how to format lg e400 phone
answers.a: This is about an LG phone; E400 is alginic acid, used in foods as a thickener, stabiliser, emulsifier, humectant, and stabiliser.

answers.q: how to update lg e400 software
answers.a: This is about a phone, but E400 denotes alginic acid—a seaweed-derived additive used to thicken and stabilize foods, not a software version.

answers.q: acid gone how much alginic acid
answers.a: It varies by product; alginate-based reflux antacids typically contain several hundred milligrams of alginic acid/sodium alginate per dose—check the specific product label for the exact amount.

Alginic acid is a polysaccharide from brown seaweed that binds water to form a viscous gel; in antacids with bicarbonate it forms a buoyant “raft” that floats on stomach contents to help reduce reflux.
